Digital-Marketing.answer3: Promotional mix, integration, creativity, interaction, globalization and resourcing.
Digital-Marketing.answer4: Promotional mix, integration, infomediation, proximity and resourcing.

Digital-Marketing.question: An online value proposition is a statement that reinforces an organization's core proposition in relation to its online offering, which must be different from the offline offering and from those of:

Digital-Marketing.answer2: It helps provide a focus to marketing efforts so that company staff is clear about the purpose of the online activities.
Digital-Marketing.answer3: If the proposition is clear it can be used for PR, and word-of-mouth recommendations may be made about the company.
Digital-Marketing.answer4: Answers a, b and c are correct.

Software-Testing.question: We split testing into distinct stages primarily because:
Software-Testing.answer1: Each test stage has a different purpose
Software-Testing.answer2: It is easier to manage testing in stages
Software-Testing.answer3: We can run different tests in different environments
Software-Testing.answer4: The more stages we have, the better the testing

Software-Testing.question: Which of the following is not a test level:
Software-Testing.answer1: Component testing
Software-Testing.answer2: System testing
Software-Testing.answer3: Client acceptance testing
Software-Testing.answer4: Interrogation testing

Software-Testing.question: Which tool would you use if a programmer wanted to express algorithm visually?
Software-Testing.answer1: Flowchart
Software-Testing.answer2: Pseudocode
Software-Testing.answer3: Storyboard
Software-Testing.answer4: Graphic user interface

Software-Testing.question: Software testing activities should start:
Software-Testing.answer1: As soon as the code is written
Software-Testing.answer2: During the design stage
Software-Testing.answer3: When the requirements have been formally documented
Software-Testing.answer4: As soon as possible in the development life cycle

Software-Testing.question: Faults found by users are due to:
Software-Testing.answer1: Poor quality software
Software-Testing.answer2: Poor software and poor testing
Software-Testing.answer3: Bad luck
Software-Testing.answer4: Insufficient time for testing

Software-Testing.question: What is the main reason for testing software before releasing it?
Software-Testing.answer1: To show that system will work after release
Software-Testing.answer2: To decide when the software is of sufficient quality to release
Software-Testing.answer3: To find as many bugs as possible before release
Software-Testing.correctAnswer: To give information for a risk based decision about release

Software-Testing.question: Which of the following statements is not true:
Software-Testing.answer1: Performance testing can be done during unit testing as well as during the testing of whole system
Software-Testing.answer2: The acceptance test does not necessarily include a regression test
Software-Testing.answer3: Verification activities should not involve testers (reviews, inspections etc)
Software-Testing.answer4: Test environments should be as similar to production as possible

Software-Testing.question: When reporting faults found to developers, testers should be:
Software-Testing.answer1: As polite, constructive and helpful as possible
Software-Testing.answer2: Firm about insisting that a bug is not a “feature” if it should be fixed
Software-Testing.answer3: Diplomatic, sensitive to the way they may react to criticism
Software-Testing.answer4: All of the above

Software-Testing.question: In which order should tests be run?
Software-Testing.answer1: The most important tests first
Software-Testing.answer2: The most difficult tests first (to allow maximum time for fixing)
Software-Testing.answer3: The easiest tests first (to give initial confidence)
Software-Testing.answer4: The order they are thought of

Software-Testing.question: The later in the development life cycle a fault is discovered, the more expensive it is to fix. Why?
Software-Testing.answer1: The documentation is poor, so it takes longer to find out what the software is doing.
Software-Testing.answer2: Wages are rising
Software-Testing.answer3: The fault has been built into more documentation, code, tests, etc
Software-Testing.answer4: None of the above

Software-Testing.question: Which is not true-The black box tester
Software-Testing.answer1: should be able to understand a functional specification or requirements document
Software-Testing.answer2: should be able to understand the source code
Software-Testing.answer3: is highly motivated to find faults
Software-Testing.answer4: is creative to find the system’s weaknesses

Software-Testing.question: A test design technique is:
Software-Testing.answer1: a process for selecting test cases
Software-Testing.answer2: a process for determining expected outputs
Software-Testing.answer3: a way to measure the quality of software
Software-Testing.answer4: a way to measure in a test plan what has to be done

Software-Testing.question: Testware(test cases, test dataset)
Software-Testing.answer1: needs configuration management just like requirements, design and code
Software-Testing.answer2: should be newly constructed for each new version of the software
Software-Testing.answer3: is needed only until the software is released into production or use
Software-Testing.answer4: all of the above

Software-Testing.question: An incident logging system
Software-Testing.answer1: only records defects
Software-Testing.answer2: is of limited value
Software-Testing.answer3: is a valuable source of project information during testing if it contains all incidents
Software-Testing.answer4: should be used only by the test team.

Software-Testing.question: Increasing the quality of the software, by better development methods, will affect the time needed for testing (the test phases) by:
Software-Testing.answer1: reducing test time
Software-Testing.answer2: no change
Software-Testing.answer3: increasing test time
Software-Testing.answer4: none of the above

Software-Testing.question: Coverage measurement
Software-Testing.answer1: is nothing to do with testing
Software-Testing.answer2: is a partial measure of test thoroughness
Software-Testing.answer3: branch coverage should be mandatory for all software
Software-Testing.answer4: can only be applied at unit or module testing, not at system testing

Software-Testing.question: When should you stop testing?
Software-Testing.answer1: when time for testing has run out
Software-Testing.answer2: when all planned tests have been run
Software-Testing.answer3: when the test completion criteria have been met
Software-Testing.answer4: when no faults have been found by the tests run

Software-Testing.question: Which of the following is true?
Software-Testing.answer1: Component testing should be black box, system testing should be white box
Software-Testing.answer2: If u find a lot of bugs in testing, you should not be very confident about the quality of software
Software-Testing.answer3: the fewer bugs you find,the better your testing was
Software-Testing.answer4: the more tests you run, the more bugs you will find

Software-Testing.question: Regression testing should be performed: (y)when the environment has changed (z)when the project manager says
Software-Testing.answer1: Every week
Software-Testing.answer2: After the software has changed
Software-Testing.answer3: As often as possible
Software-Testing.answer4: When the project manager says

Software-Testing.question: What is the important criterion in deciding what testing technique to use?
Software-Testing.answer1: how well you know a particular technique
Software-Testing.answer2: the objective of the test
Software-Testing.answer3: how appropriate the technique is for testing the application
Software-Testing.answer4: whether there is a tool to support the technique

Software-Testing.question: If the pseudo code below were a programming language ,how many tests are required to achieve 100% statement coverage? 1.If x=3 then 2. Display_messageX; 3. If y=2 then 4. Display_messageY; 5.Else 6.Display_messageZ; 7.Else 8.Display_messageZ
Software-Testing.answer1: v & w are true, x, y & z are false
Software-Testing.answer2: w, x & y are true, v & z are false
Software-Testing.answer3: w & y are true, v, x & z are false
Software-Testing.answer4: w is true, v, x, y & z are false

Software-Testing.question: Which of the following is NOT a type of non-functional test?
Software-Testing.answer1: State-Transition
Software-Testing.answer2: Usability
Software-Testing.answer3: Performance
Software-Testing.answer4: Security

Software-Testing.question: Which of the following  tools would you use to detect a memory leak?
Software-Testing.answer1: State analysis
Software-Testing.answer2: Coverage analysis
Software-Testing.answer3: Dynamic analysis
Software-Testing.answer4: Memory analysis

Software-Testing.question: What is the purpose of a test completion criterion?
Software-Testing.answer1: to know when a specific test has finished its execution
Software-Testing.answer2: to ensure that the test case specification is complete
Software-Testing.answer3: to set the criteria used in generating test inputs
Software-Testing.answer4: to determine when to stop testing

Software-Testing.question: Given the following code, which statement is true about the minimum number of test cases required for full statement and branch coverage? Read p Read q IF p+q > 100 THEN Print 'Large' ENDIF IF p > 50 THEN Print 'p Large' ENDIF
Software-Testing.answer1: 1 test for statement coverage, 3 for branch coverage
Software-Testing.answer2: 1 test for statement coverage, 2 for branch coverage
Software-Testing.answer3: 1 test for statement coverage, 1 for branch coverage
Software-Testing.answer4: 2 tests for statement coverage, 2 for branch coverage

Software-Testing.question: Functional system testing is:
Software-Testing.answer1: testing that the system functions with other systems
Software-Testing.answer2: testing that the components that comprise the system function together
Software-Testing.answer3: testing the end to end functionality of the system as a whole
Software-Testing.answer4: testing the system performs functions within specified response times

Software-Testing.question: What can static analysis NOT find?
Software-Testing.answer1: the use of a variable before it has been defined
Software-Testing.answer2: unreachable (“dead”) code
Software-Testing.answer3: memory leaks
Software-Testing.answer4: array bound violations

Software-Testing.question: A typical commercial test execution tool would be able to perform all of the following, EXCEPT:
Software-Testing.answer1: calculating expected outputs
Software-Testing.answer2: comparison of expected outcomes with actual outcomes
Software-Testing.answer3: recording test inputs
Software-Testing.answer4: reading test values from a data file

Software-Testing.question: Expected results are:
Software-Testing.answer1: only important in system testing
Software-Testing.answer2: only used in component
Software-Testing.answer3: most useful when specified in advance
Software-Testing.answer4: derived from the code

Software-Testing.question: Which of the following uses Impact Analysis most?
Software-Testing.answer1: component testing
Software-Testing.answer2: non-functional system testing
Software-Testing.answer3: user acceptance testing
Software-Testing.answer4: maintenance testing

Data-Science.answer2: Machine learning focuses on prediction, based on known properties learned from the training data
Data-Science.answer3: Representing data in a form which both mere mortals can understand and get valuable insights is as much a science as much as it is art
Data-Science.answer4: Data Cleaning focuses on prediction, based on known properties learned from the training data
